Token.Abstract: Provides a mechanism for maintaining scoped variable values in the context of a particular MBVariableSpace instance.
Returns the MBVariableSpace instance in which the scoped variables will be stored.
Returns the MBVariableSpace instance in which the scoped variables will be stored.
Returns the MBVariableSpace instance in which the scoped variables will be stored.
Returns the MBScopedVariables instance that represents the current variable scope associated with the calling thread.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The current scope, or nil if there isn't one.

Token.Abstract: Enters a new variable scope on the calling thread using the MBVariableSpace associated with the current MBEnvironment.

ReturnValue.Abstract: A newly-created MBScopedVariables instance representing the new scope. Until the scope is exited, code running on the calling thread will be able to retrieve this scope through the currentVariableScope method.

Token.Abstract: Exits the current variable scope--if there is one--associated with the calling thread. Any variables set within the scope being exited will be removed from that scope's variableSpace, and the variable values will return to what they were prior to entering the scope.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The MBScopedVariables instance representing the scope that was exited, or nil if there was no current scope at the time of calling and therefore there was no scope to exit.

Token.Abstract: Allows accessing scoped variable values using the keyed subscripting notation.

Parameter.Name: variableName
Parameter.Abstract: The name of the scoped variable whose value is to be retrieved.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The in-scope value of the MBML variable named variableName.

Token.Abstract: Allows setting a scoped variable value using the keyed subscripting notation.

Parameter.Name: value
Parameter.Abstract: The new value for the MBML variable.

Parameter.Name: variableName
Parameter.Abstract: The name of the scoped variable whose value is to be set.

Token.Abstract: Removes from the receiver's variableSpace all variables set using the scope. The values in the variableSpace will return to what they were prior to the scope becoming active.
Reapplies any scoped variables that were previously unset using unsetScopedVariables (and have not been set again since).
